alert.note: Alert for Madison; Oglethorpe; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:25AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wilkes, Oglethorpe and southeastern Madison Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 825 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Smithonia, or 7 miles north of Lexington, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Comer, Crawford, Colbert, Carlton, Rayle, Jacksons Crossroads, Smithonia, Watson Mill Bridge State Park, Vesta and Point Peter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
